abstract.text: An object that provides keyframe animation capabilities for a layer object.

inlineContent.text: method, specifying the key path of the property that you want to animate on the layer. You can then specify the keyframe values to use to control the timing and animation behavior.
For most types of animations, you specify the keyframe values using the

properties. During the animation, Core Animation generates intermediate values by interpolating between the values you provide. When animating a value that is a coordinate point, such as the layer’s position, you can specify a
for that point to follow instead of individual values. The pacing of the animation is controlled by the timing information you provide.
The following code shows how to create a keyframe animation that animates a layer’s background color from red to green to blue over a two second duration.

abstract.text: Render, compose, and animate visual elements.
An interface that allows instances to respond to actions triggered by a Core Animation layer change.
The abstract superclass for animations in Core Animation.
Methods your app can implement to respond when animations start and stop.
An object that provides basic, single-keyframe animation capabilities for a layer property.
An object that provides keyframe animation capabilities for a layer object.
An array of numbers that define the position of the curve relative to a control point.
Specifies how intermediate keyframe values are calculated by the receiver.
An array of numbers that define the sharpness of the timing curve’s corners.
An optional array of
objects that define the time at which to apply a given keyframe segment.
The path for a point-based property to follow.
Determines whether objects animating along the path rotate to match the path tangent.
An array of numbers that define the tightness of the curve.
An optional array of
objects that define the pacing for each keyframe segment.
An array of objects that specify the keyframe values to use for the animation.
Methods that model a hierarchical timing system, allowing objects to map time between their parent and local time.
An abstract subclass for creating animations that manipulate the value of layer properties.
Creates and returns an
instance for the specified key path.
An animation that applies a spring-like force to a layer’s properties.
An object that provides an animated transition between a layer’s states.
An object that provides a flexible method of defining animated transformations.

A protocol that enables an object to be encoded and decoded for archiving and distribution.
A protocol that objects adopt to provide functional copies of themselves.
The group of methods that are fundamental to all Objective-C objects.
A protocol that enables encoding and decoding in a manner that is robust against object substitution attacks.
A type that can be hashed into a `Hasher` to produce an integer hash value.
A type that can be compared for value equality.
A type with a customized textual representation.
A type with a customized textual representation suitable for debugging purposes.
A type whose instances can be encoded, and appropriately passed, as elements of a C `va_list`.
A thread-safe type whose values can be shared across arbitrary concurrent contexts without introducing a risk of data races.
